title: Watchdog probing supermarket supply deals (AAP)
content:
Woolworths and Aldi are among supermarkets being investigated by the competition watchdog over reports new supply agreements are falling short of an industry code of conduct meant to protect grocery suppliers. 

Australian Competition and Consumer Commission chairman Rod Sims says he is concerned about reports that retailers, particularly Woolworths and Aldi, are presenting suppliers with contracts that "might give the impression that the supplier is not about to negotiate the terms". 

The ACCC is also concerned about a lack of detail in agreements about when supermarkets will seek payment from suppliers for breakage and wastage that occurs in-store.
